thread.title: Rewinding Gus Malzahn discussing Auburn QB situation, receivers, Kentucky on Tiger Talk
thread.title_full: Rewinding Gus Malzahn discussing Auburn QB situation, receivers, Kentucky on Tiger Talk | AL.com

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Rewinding Gus Malzahn discussing Auburn QB situation, receivers, Kentucky on Tiger Talk
text:
Gus Malzahn appeared live on the Tiger Talk radio program at 7:30 p.m. CT to review Auburn's bye week and look ahead to Thursday's game at Kentucky.
Tiger Talk, an hour-long radio show, can be heard on these affiliates . The show is also available via live steam .
Below is a quick recap
---
** Weekly schedule is aligned differently with Thursday night. Monday equals normal Wednesday.
** Last Thursday was used as an "extra head start" for Kentucky
** On opening competition at all positions: "I think competition brings out the best in everybody."
** Malzahn says team got healthier, specifically older guys
** When will Auburn name a starting QB? "We're going to make a decision after (Tuesday)'s practice, more than likely." Says Sean White has done a good job, Jeremy Johnson has also done well in practice since being benched.
** Fan question: Tanner asks do you think sitting out two games has helped Jeremy Johnson?
"It probably did. He got a chance to look at things from a different standpoint. Got a chance to go back to the basics in practice."
** John asks about emphasis on explosive plays: "There's no doubt." Says there's been "little to none"
** Malzahn says cites Tony Stevens, Ricardo Louis and Jason Smith among wide receivers to step up since dismissal of D'haquille Williams
** Reiterates Devonte Danzey and Avery Young are leaders as backup center with loss of Xavier Dampeer
** Fan question: Brandon asks about TE/HBs in passing game:
"The H-backs are guys that are definitely good. ... In the past we've done a solid job with that."
** AL.com question of the week: How do you tune out outside noise to make best decisions?
"I just think that's part of the job. ... You always think what's best for the team, that's what I try to do."
Malzahn goes on to say Tom Osbourne, Tom Landry were coaches he emulated early in his career
** On close call with JSU helping AU, as UK might benefit from OT win over EKU: "It goes to show you got to play good football every Saturday."
** On possibly going under center in goal-to-go: "We'll mix it up"
** "Offensively we've got to get some pace going, some tempo going, and we've got to have explosive plays."
